name: biomni-design-knockout-sgrna
title: Biomni: Design Knockout Sgrna
description: Design optimized sgRNAs for CRISPR-Cas9 gene knockout
content:
Overview

This tool designs optimized single guide RNAs (sgRNAs) for CRISPR-Cas9 mediated gene knockout. It queries validated sgRNA libraries to find guides targeting specific genes with high on-target activity and minimal off-target effects. The tool retrieves pre-validated sgRNA sequences with associated efficiency scores to maximize knockout success rates.

Input Parameters

  • gene_name: Target gene symbol (e.g., EGFR, TP53, BRCA1)
  • data_lake_path: Path to sgRNA library data repository
  • --species: Target organism species (default: human). Options include human, mouse, etc.
  • --num-guides: Number of sgRNA guides to return (default: 1)

Input Format

Command-line arguments format:

python design_knockout_sgrna.py "TP53" "/path/to/data" --species human --num-guides 3 -o output/

Provide gene name and data path as positional arguments, with optional species and guide number specifications.

Biological Use Case

Critical for CRISPR genome editing experiments:

  • Design sgRNAs for functional gene knockout studies
  • Generate loss-of-function mutants for disease modeling
  • Create knockout cell lines for drug target validation
  • Perform genetic screens with pooled sgRNA libraries
  • Engineer therapeutic gene knockouts (e.g., CCR5 for HIV resistance)
  • Validate gene function through CRISPR-mediated disruption

Output

Returns a JSON file (e.g., TP53_sgrnas.json) containing sgRNA sequences, PAM sequences, target positions, on-target scores, and predicted off-target sites for the requested number of guides.

Category

molecular_biology
